lead_paragraph: The Yankees’ Phil Hughes will make his second rehabilitation start Friday in Trenton for the Class AA Thunder, the Yankees announced yesterday.Hughes, the touted rookie right-hander, has not pitched in the major leagues since May 1, when he strained his hamstring against the Texas Rangers. He injured his left ankle three weeks later during an agility drill.The Mets were also active on the pitching rehabilitation front, with Oliver Pérez pitching four scoreless innings yesterday for the Class A Gulf Coast Mets. Pérez, who missed his last start for the Mets because of back pain, allowed no runs and struck out seven.
